name: Monart

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wonderful boyfriend brought me to the Monart a number of weeks ago. Because we set off straight after work, neither of us had eaten earlier. We were both looking forward to dinner and were both fairly exhausted following a busy week.
reviews.title: great experience but book an early dinner!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The drive into the estate is truly wonderful. We pulled up outside in pouring rain to be greeted by a valet who carried in our coats and various 'bits' that we had collected in our frenzied rush to arrive before the weekend traffic. A lovely receptionist checked us in and asked us if we intended eating in the hotel that evening. Boyfriend explained that he had made a dinner reservation when booking the room. No record of this however, a table was arranged for us for 8 that evening.
reviews.title: very nicey but quite pricey

likes.disliked: — Nothing that would make me write it here

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The room was beautiful as was the huge bathroom stocked with an array of lotions and potions. Bed was also so very comfy. Another plus was the balcony and the tilt and turn windows which allowed us to keep the door/window open at night (something that so many new hotels overlook).
reviews.title: great place-terrible service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Boyfriend is not a pampering-type man but was delighted that the room had a dvd player and he brought his own movies to watch whilst I lounged in the spa.
reviews.title: overpriced

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Following a swim and a shower, we crawled to dinner famished and weary. We were promptly brought to our table, ordered food and a bottle of wine almost immediately and waited. The wine arrived but no food. We waited.....and waited. By nine o'clock the bottle of wine had been polished off and yet no sign of so much as a starter. Because I was tired and now a little tipsy and because this had been a surprise from my boyfriend, I didn't want to complain too much. We did ask passing waiting staff if our meal was due to arrive and they assured us that it was. Our main course arrived at ten. By the time we had finished eating, most of the other diners had left the restaurant. I had a thumping headache and simply yearned for bed. To 'compensate' us for the tardy arrival of the meal, management brought us a Baileys and a brandy?! Really at this stage I had drunk more than enough. Perhaps management could have considered something a little more imaginative. In fairness, neither of us did complain but I would choose to eat at the earlier sitting if I were to visit again.
reviews.title: Lovely weekend

likes.disliked: — lack of special offers on treatments

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and i stayed in Monart for 2 nites in August 08.
reviews.title: Top Class

likes.disliked: — The food was overpriced for what it was

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall i have to say that Monart is a wonderful spot for a short getaway..The location is idyllic, the grounds and buildings are in perfect keeping with the local countryside and you really do feel as if you have got away from it all.
reviews.title: Relaxation

likes.liked: — The Beds and linen very comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bedrooms are huge, modern and very very comfortable, with lovely views of the woods.
reviews.title: Short Christmas Break in Monart

likes.liked: — Service, relaxed environment, spa facilities and food
likes.disliked: — TV in the bedroom, how busy the spa and restaurants can be

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The spa itself is very luxurious, and again it is all low rise and fits in perfectly with the area, especially the log cabin sauna. It did take a while to get used to just wearing a dressing gown all day! The spa experience with the pools, saunas, steam rooms etc kept you occcuplied for hours, and we did have a treatment each included in the package. We felt you could spend a fortune if you wanted to, but if you were content with a treatment or two and the spa experience it wasnt too bad.
reviews.title: Delievered on the promise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: Overall a lovely relaxing getaway, and my only gripe was that the food was very overpriced for what it was, but as a special treat go for the afternoon tea and pastries...yummy!
reviews.title: Did not want to leave!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed with my husband for a romantic getaway. I have to say the place is beautiful. Staff very friendly & helpful but...
reviews.title: Over-priced!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: We both found it very expensive for what you get and what I didn't like was walking around in your robe with people coming and going in the bar...!!!
reviews.title: plush

likes.liked: — you switch off the minute you go through the door

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was missing something for the amount of money that you pay. We had no change from €700.00 for one night stay & a treatment. We both agreed it would be better to put the money into a nice hotel with a spa included. Much better value for money
reviews.title: a total escape

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: this was my 4th stay here. we stayed midweek so the place was lovely & quiet. everything was fantasic, staff, rooms, food, spa all amzing. very expensive but a real treat.
reviews.title: Worth every penny

likes.liked: — Comfort, attention to detail, real privacy and luxury, fabulous spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: no need to say more, save up & go!
reviews.title: Utter tranquility

likes.liked: — Huge comfortable bed, spacious room, superb housekeeping excellent service and food
likes.disliked: — Would have liked tea/coffee making facilities in our room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I recently had a one night break away at Monart and we both have much to say on its merits (as well as its demerits).
reviews.title: Almost too expensive

likes.disliked: — cost of treatments, restaurant menu and delivery

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We really enjoyed the exclusivity of 'buzzing in' and having such personal attention, including having our car parked and our luggage subsequently delivered to our rooms :-) On that note, we were perplexed as to whether or not to tip the staff member who brought our bags up to our room. (We were equally confused about tipping in the Garden Lounge and in the restaurant).
reviews.title: Absolutely Fab!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Upon arrival, we were impressed by the decor, which, as other reviewers have pointed out, merged the modern with the classic. Overall, the feeling is one of tranquil opulence.
reviews.title: Perfect for a romantic break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We each had treatments on the afternoon of our arrival, so were quickly directed to the Spa, which is beautifully decorated and suitably quiet. My husband didn't really enjoy the first treatment; he was bored to be honest. He also said that he disliked intensely the looped piped cds of 'relaxing' musak. [I have had to admit since, having listened to the same over Garden Lounge meal, treatments, evening meal in restaurant, breakfast and following day treatments, I felt the same. At least there was no pan pipe music though...]
reviews.title: Expensive & overrated.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the afternoon and evening of our arrival, respectively, we ate in the Garden Lounge and in the in the Monart Restaurant. It has to be said that the service in both was second to none, and we mean just that. In the lounge, Simon, was a testament to professionalism, and the personnel in the restaurant, particularly that of the the three male staff members: Karol, Patrick and another gentleman, whose name we have misplaced, was outstanding. All three welcomed us warmly and genuinely, and were attentive to our every need, even as far as the absolutely anti-social habit of smoking is concerned.
reviews.title: Mid Week in Monart

description: Monart Spa is graded 5 Star and is regarded by many as one of the world's leading destination spas. Monart has been awarded runner up for Best Spa Retreat Overseas (Worldwide) 2010 by Conde Nast Traveller. Monart has also been awarded Best Spa in Ireland by Irish Tatler Magazine for the second consecutive year.
